body: This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/toxcore/17)

comment_data.body:
That looks like it will underflow if target_size is between 0 and 56 ( `crypto_box_PUBLICKEYBYTES + crypto_box_NONCEBYTES`), is that intended?
Maybe `s/target_size/(long)target_size)/` so the crypto_box_\* constants don't convert the int expression to unsigned ?

I actually had that check rolled into the  the null check above. I ended up removing it because the calling function needs to also provide the type ( the -1 ), the  pubkey, and the nonce. If you're providing a buffer smaller than the data you're providing, you get what you deserve?

Thoughts?
Fair enough, as long as the function is not public (if it is public, then it might be better to check the caller didn't screw up, or at least assert() so we can catch mistakes in debug mode).

comment_regular_data.body:
Review status: 0 of 1 files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion. --- _[toxcore/DHT.c, line 209 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/17#-KOTfDARzZCCJZigk_1N-r1-209:-KOcP_L3sjYmjmJvIokk:bgccys4) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/56f2b5d1a46f3df62cdb6a20b2d798b19ccb263f/toxcore/DHT.c#L209)):_
Previously, tux3 (Tux3) wrote… > Fair enough, as long as the function is not public (if it is public, then it might be better to check the caller didn't screw up, or at least assert() so we can catch mistakes in debug mode). >
> I think an assert is probably a good idea. Once I find out what @iphydf wants, I'll write something. @tux3 There's also the pending question if we're going to rewrite DHT.c to be a bit more modular. And much more test and maintainable. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/17)_
Could at least have mentioned any specific spec paragraph.

Review status: 0 of 1 files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion, some commit checks failed. --- _[toxcore/DHT.c, line 209 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/17#-KOTfDARzZCCJZigk_1N-r1-209:-KPGHoJDAjqdTbSSudDV:bwldano) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/56f2b5d1a46f3df62cdb6a20b2d798b19ccb263f/toxcore/DHT.c#L209)):_
Previously, nurupo wrote… > +1 for assert. >
> I suggest changing the check to ``` C if (target_size < 1 + crypto_box_PUBLICKEYBYTES + crypto_box_NONCEBYTES + data_size) { ``` the RHS gets promoted to `unsigned int`, so that check doesn't underflow/overflow, assuming `sizeof(unsigned int) > sizeof(uint16_t)`, because if that assumption doesn't hold, then the RHS could overflow. If we don't want to assume `sizeof(unsigned int) > sizeof(uint16_t)`, then we should check for the overflow of the RHS separately ``` C if ( (data_size < 1 + crypto_box_PUBLICKEYBYTES + crypto_box_NONCEBYTES + data_size) && (target_size < 1 + crypto_box_PUBLICKEYBYTES + crypto_box_NONCEBYTES + data_size) ) { ``` @iphy, your thoughts? --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/17)_
@GrayHatter what is the occasion for the special 2-space indentation?

The 2 spaces formatting here is from the .clang-format style used by the hstox tests, (they're set to 2 spaces per indent for legacy reasons).  I didn't notice the wrong indentation here. 

(Anyone reading: It should be 4 spaces in Toxcore, not 2)

commit.message: Added skel fxn to create DHT packets in alignment with the spec
